meanings.definition: Seizas (noun): a unit of land measurement in Japan, equal to about 0.25 acres.
meanings.sent1: The farmer measured his field in seizas to determine its size.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent estimated the land to be around five seizas in total.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game pretending each square of the garden was a seizas.
meanings.sent4: The vast forest stretched out for many seizas, as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent5: The ancient map showed the kingdom divided into countless seizas of fertile land.

meanings.definition: Seizas (verb): to take possession of property by legal authority.
meanings.sent1: The government had to seizas the abandoned house after years of neglect.
meanings.sent2: The court granted the bank the right to seizas the assets of the bankrupt company.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon tried to seizas the picnic basket when nobody was looking.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to seizas control of the town, causing chaos and destruction.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to seizas the evidence before it was tampered with.
